organization.fullName: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

identificationModule.briefTitle: Safety Trial of Antimicrobial Therapy and Precision Radiation Therapy in Patients With Oligoprogressive Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: Safety Trial of Antimicrobial Therapy and Precision Radiation Therapy in Patients With Oligoprogressive Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

leadSponsor.name: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The first phase of this study was an open label, randomized pilot study. Enrollment for this phase is now complete.

The second phase is a single arm phase 1 safety study. Patients planned to undergo precision hypofractionated radiation to all sites of oligoprogression will receive vancomycin for 1 week before RT and for 1 month after start of RT, and asked to provide stool and blood samples as outlined in the Safety Trial study table.

conditions: Early Stage Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

armGroups.label: Arm 1 - Experimental
armGroups.description: Patients planned to undergo precision hypofractionated radiation to all sites of oligoprogression will receive vancomycin for 1 week before RT and for 1 month after start of RT, and asked to provide stool and blood samples as outlined in the Safety Trial study table.

interventions.name: Precision hypofractionated radiation
interventions.description: Patients planned to undergo precision hypofractionated radiation to all sites of oligoprogression and will receive vancomycin for 1 week before RT and for 1 month after start of RT, and asked to provide stool and blood samples as outlined in the Safety Trial study table.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Randomized Pilot: Th1 immune response measured by cytokine expression (IFN gamma).
primaryOutcomes.description: The primary endpoint is IFN-gamma cytokine expression at Day 30 (+/- 2) collection compared to the pre-radiation level. It will be analyzed using generalized linear mixed models.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Randomized Pilot: the safety of the addition of vancomycin to Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy
primaryOutcomes.description: The primary safety endpoint is uncontrolled diarrhea, as defined by CTCAE v4.0 \> or = grade 3 (Increase of \>=7 stools per day over baseline; incontinence; hospitalization indicated; severe increase in ostomy output compared to baseline; limiting self-care ADL). This will be evaluated during treatment and at 1 month, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Safety Trial: the safety of the addition of vancomycin to precision hypofractionated radiation
primaryOutcomes.description: Safety Trial: The primary safety endpoint is uncontrolled diarrhea, as defined by CTCAE v5.0 \> or = grade 3 Increase of \>=7 stools per day over baseline; hospitalization indicated; severe increase in ostomy output compared to baseline; limiting self care ADL). This will be evaluated weekly during vancomycin use and RT, at 1 month post-vancomycin, 3 months post-vancomycin, 6 months post-vancomycin and 12 months post-vancomycin.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Randomized Pilot Inclusion

* Patients planned to receive Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy (SBRT) to a biopsy-proven or clinically-suspected NSCLC
* Age \>18 years' old
* Patient capable of giving informed consent

Randomized Pilot Exclusion

* Use of antibiotics, antifungal, antivirals or antiparasitics during the 4 weeks prior to registration
* Active infection with oral temperature \>100°F
* Use of corticosteroids, methotrexate or immunosuppressive drugs during the 4 weeks prior to registration
* Use of chemotherapy during the 4 weeks prior to radiotherapy or during radiotherapy. Chemotherapy cannot begin before the collection of the 30-day post treatment sample (S4).
* Documented history of HIV, HBV or HCV
* Active uncontrolled gastrointestinal disorders such as inflammatory bowel disease, moderate/severe irritable bowel syndrome, persistent, infectious gastroenteritis, colitis or gastritis, persistent or chronic diarrhea of unknown etiology, Clostridium Difficile infection (within 2 years of lung cancer diagnosis) or Helicobacter Pylori infection (untreated)
* Major surgery of the GI tract, with the exception of cholecystectomy and appendectomy, in the past five years. Any major bowel resection at any time
* Patients on anti-diarrheal medications
* Patients on probiotics

Safety Trial Inclusion

* Patients planned to receive precision hypofractionated radiation (SBRT or an ablative dose of radiation is used if SBRT is not appropriate or if insurance does not approve - i.e. \> 30 Gy in 10 fraction equivalent) to all sites of oligoprogressive NSCLC who progressed after 1st line systemic therapy which included immunotherapy
* The number of sites of progression are \< 5 sites.
* Age \>18 years' old
* Patient capable of giving informed consent

Safety Trial Exclusion

* Evidence of CNS or leptomeningeal disease
* Use of antibiotics, antifungal, antivirals or antiparasitics during the 4 weeks prior to registration
* Active infection with oral temperature \>100°F
* Use of corticosteroids, methotrexate or immunosuppressive drugs during the 4 weeks prior to registration
* Use of chemotherapy during the 4 weeks prior to radiotherapy or during radiotherapy. Chemotherapy cannot begin before the collection of the 30-day post treatment sample (S3).
* Documented history of HIV, HBV or HCV
* Active uncontrolled gastrointestinal disorders such as inflammatory bowel disease, moderate/severe irritable bowel syndrome, persistent, infectious gastroenteritis, colitis or gastritis, persistent or chronic diarrhea of unknown etiology, Clostridium Difficile infection (within 2 years of lung cancer diagnosis) or Helicobacter Pylori infection (untreated)
* Major surgery of the GI tract, with the exception of cholecystectomy and appendectomy, in the past five years. Any major bowel resection at any time
* Patients on anti-diarrheal medications
* Use of probiotics during the 4 weeks prior to radiotherapy or during radiotherapy
